intro: Barleria longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Barleria longipes is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
